Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a visual designer, when you switch to a designer view (such as `Design` view in [!INCLUDE[vs_current_short](~/includes/vs-current-short-md.md)]), the markup that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control is parsed. A design-time version of the control is then created on the design surface. When you switch to source view, the design-time control is persisted as markup for the Web page.
The properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner> class provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns the list of items that are used to create a smart tag panel.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.PagedControlID%2A> property is used as the designer (shadowed) version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the templated pager fields of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, which indicates that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control in order to generate the design-time markup.
The methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner> class provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> methods return the HTML markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to add or remove properties from the properties grid for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection is not empty, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml> method refreshes the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object to force the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to be called and then calls its base implementation. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection is empty, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml> method invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate the markup.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method is used by the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control at design time if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection is empty. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.CreatePlaceHolderDesignTimeHtml%28System.String%29> method to create a placeholder that displays the type and the ID of the control, and additional instructions for the user.

Docs.summary: Initializes the control designer and loads the specified control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The designer host calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.Initialize%2A> method and its base methods configure properties and connect to events that are required for the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method adds a new property to the property grid of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control that corresponds to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PagedControlID%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InTemplateMode%2A> property is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method also sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> attribute of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `BrowsableAttribute.No`. This prevents pager fields from being deleted by using the `Fields` dialog box when a templated pager field is in template mode.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataPagerDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property creates a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> objects that represent the template elements in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control at design time. It adds one element to the collection for each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.Fields%2A> collection of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
